packageMeta.name: purescript-halogen
packageMeta.description: A declarative, type-safe UI library for PureScript

declarations.comments:
A variant of `Exists` that works for type constructors that accept a _row_
of types.
declarations.title: ExistsR

declarations.comments:
The `mkExistsR` function is used to introduce a value of type `ExistsR f`,
by providing a value of type `f a`, for some row of types `a` which will be
hidden in the existentially-quantified type.
declarations.title: mkExistsR

declarations.comments:
The `runExistsR` function is used to eliminate a value of type `ExistsR f`.
The rank 2 type ensures that the existentially-quantified type does not
escape its scope. Since the function is required to work for _any_ row of
types `a`, it will work for the existentially-quantified type.
declarations.title: runExistsR

declarations.comments: Compatible with `Prism` from `purescript-lens`.
declarations.title: Prism

declarations.comments: Compatible with `PrismP` from `purescript-lens`.
declarations.title: Injector

declarations.comments:
An intermediate algebra used to associate values from a child component's
algebra with the slot the component was installed into.
declarations.title: ChildF

declarations.comments: A type alias for self-contained Halogen components.
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments: The DSL used in the `eval` function for self-contained components.
declarations.title: ComponentDSL

declarations.comments: The type for `HTML` rendered by a self-contained component.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments:
Data type for Halogen components.
- `s` - the component's state
- `f` - the component's query algebra
- `g` - a functor integrated into the component's query algebra that allows
        embedding of external DSLs or handling of effects.
- `o` - the type of values observable via `peek`, used to allow parent
        components to see queries their children have acted upon.
- `p` - the type of slot addresses within the component - these values
        allow queries to child components to be specifically addressed.
declarations.title: ComponentP

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `eval` function - takes a functorial value `i`
and returns a `Free` of the Halogen component algebra.

Usually `i` will be the same type as `f`, but sometimes it is useful to be
able to break up an `Eval` function into different parts, in which case
`i`'s type may differ.
declarations.title: Eval

declarations.comments:
A variation on `Eval` for parent components - the function follows the
same form but the type representation is different.
declarations.title: EvalParent

declarations.comments:
The type used by component containers for their state where `s` is the
state local to the container, `p` is the type of slot used by the
container, and the remaining parameters are the type variables for the
child components.
declarations.title: InstalledState

declarations.comments: The DSL used in the `eval` and `peek` functions for parent components.
declarations.title: ParentDSL

declarations.comments: The type for `HTML` rendered by a parent component.
declarations.title: ParentHTML

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `peek` function that observes inputs to child
components.
declarations.title: Peek

declarations.comments:
An intermediate algebra that parent components "produce" from their `eval`
and `peek` functions. This takes the place of `g` when compared to a leaf
(non-parent) component.
declarations.title: QueryF

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `render` function - takes the component's
current state and returns a `HTML` value.
declarations.title: Render

declarations.comments:
A variation on `Render` for parent components - the function follows the
same form but the type representation is different.
declarations.title: RenderParent

declarations.comments: The type used for slots in the HTML rendered by parent components.
declarations.title: SlotConstructor

declarations.comments: Builds a self-contained component with no possible children.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments:
Lifts a state value into an `InstalledState` value. Useful when providing
an initial state value for a parent component.
declarations.title: installedState

declarations.comments:
Changes the component's `g` type. A use case for this would be to interpret
some `Free` monad as `Aff` so the component can be used with `runUI`.
declarations.title: interpret

declarations.comments:
Lifts a value in the `QueryF` algebra into the monad used by a component's
`eval` function.
declarations.title: liftQuery

declarations.comments:
Creates a query for a child component where `p` is the slot the component
was installed into and `f' i` in the input query.

If a component is not found for the slot the result of the query
will be `Nothing`.
declarations.title: mkQuery

declarations.comments:
A version of [`mkQuery`](#mkQuery) for use when a parent component has
multiple types of child component.
declarations.title: mkQuery'

declarations.comments: Builds a component that may contain child components.
declarations.title: parentComponent

declarations.comments:
Builds a component that may contain child components and additionally
supports the `peek` operation to allow the parent to observe queries that
descendant components have processed.
declarations.title: parentComponent'

declarations.comments:
Queries a child component, for use within a parent component's `eval` or
`peek` function.
declarations.title: query

declarations.comments:
A version of [`query`](#query) for use when a parent component has multiple
types of child component.
declarations.title: query'

declarations.comments:
Runs a compnent's `query` function with the specified query input and
returns the pending computation as a `Free` monad.
declarations.title: queryComponent

declarations.comments:
Runs a component's `render` function with the specified state, returning
the generated `HTML` and new state.
declarations.title: renderComponent

declarations.comments: Transforms a `Component`'s types using a `ChildPath` definition.
declarations.title: transformChild

declarations.comments:
Type alias for driver functions generated by `runUI` - a driver takes an
input of the query algebra (`f`) and returns an `Aff` that returns when
query has been fulfilled.
declarations.title: Driver

declarations.comments:
This function is the main entry point for a Halogen based UI.

The returned value contains the HTML element for the component tree that
then needs attaching to the DOM, and a driver function that can be used to
send actions and requests into the component hierarchy.

The returned driver function allows the "outside world" to communicate
with the UI - a common use case it to use the driver to changes to the
application state in combination with a routing library.
declarations.title: runUI

declarations.comments:
A type alias for the basic row of effects that Halogen uses. This can be
combined with app-specific effects to help keep type signatures more
manageable:

```purescript
type AppEffects eff = HalogenEffects (ajax :: AJAX, console :: CONSOLE | eff)

ui :: forall eff. Component State Query (Aff (AppEffects eff))
ui = ...

main :: Eff (AppEffects ()) Unit
main = runAff throwException (const (pure unit)) $ do
  app <- runUI ui state
  ...
```
declarations.title: HalogenEffects

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "action" - An action only causes effects and has no
result value.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as a value. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a
  = SomeAction a
  | SomeOtherAction String a
  | NotAnAction (Boolean -> a)
```

Both `SomeAction` and `SomeOtherAction` have `a` as a value so they are
considered actions, whereas `NotAnAction` has `a` as the result of a
function so is considered to be a "request" ([see below](#Request)).
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a coroutine producer used to represent a subscribable
source of events.
declarations.title: EventSource

declarations.comments: A type alias for the Halogen component algebra.
declarations.title: HalogenF

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "request" - a request can cause effects as well as
fetching some information from a component.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as the return value of a function. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = SomeRequest (Boolean -> a)
```
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments: The state algebra.
declarations.title: StateF

declarations.comments: The subscribe algebra.
declarations.title: SubscribeF

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates an action.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = Tick a

sendTick :: forall eff. Driver Query eff -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Unit
sendTick driver = driver (action Tick)
```
declarations.title: action

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts one argument.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onCopied = eventSource (Editor.onCopy editor) \text -> do
      pure $ actionF (TextCopied text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onChange = eventSource_ (Session.onChange session) do
      text <- Editor.getValue editor
      pure $ actionF (ChangeText text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource_

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of accessing the current component's state within an `Eval`
or `Peek` function. This is much like `get` for the `State` monad, but
instead of operating in some `StateT`, uses the `HalogenF` algebra. For
example:

``` purescript
data Query a = GetState (State -> a)

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (GetState k) = do
  currentState <- get
  pure (k currentState)
```
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
A version of [`get`](#get) that maps over the retrieved state before
returning the result. Useful in cases where only a portion of the state is
desired. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = GetX (Number -> a)
type State = { x :: Number, y :: Number }

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (GetX k) = do
  x <- gets _.x
  pure (k x)
```
declarations.title: gets

declarations.comments: Changes the `g` for a `HalogenF`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: hoistHalogenF

declarations.comments:
Changes the underlying monad for an `EventSource`. Used internally by
Halogen.
declarations.title: hoistSubscribe

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting an `Aff` action directly into a
`Free HalogenF` when there is a `MonadAff` instance for the current `g`,
without the need to use `liftH $ liftAff $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftAff'

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting an `Eff` action directly into a
`Free HalogenF` when there is a `MonadEff` instance for the current `g`,
without the need to use `liftH $ liftEff $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftEff'

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting a `g` value directly into
`Free HalogenF` without the need to use `liftF $ right $ right $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftH

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of modifying the current component's state within an `Eval`
or `Peek` function. This is much like `modify` for the `State` monad, but
instead of operating in some `StateT`, uses the `HalogenF` algebra. For
example:

``` purescript
data Query a = Increment a
type State = Int

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (Increment next) = do
  modify (+ 1)
  pure next
```
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates a request.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = GetTickCount (Int -> a)

getTickCount :: forall eff. Driver Query eff -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Int
getTickCount driver = driver (request GetTickCount)
```
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of having a component subscribe to an `EventSource` from
within an `Eval` or `Peek` function.
declarations.title: subscribe

modules.name: Halogen
modules.comments:
The base Halogen module re-exports most of the library's useful types and
combinators, aside from the `HTML`-building functionality - the HTML
modules export a large number of commonly named values that are likely to
conflict.

declarations.comments:
A specialised version of the `Halogen.HTML.Core.HTML` type where `i` is
`* -> *` kinded to match the kind of a component query algebra.
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments:
A specialised version of the `Halogen.HTML.Core.Prop` type where `i` is
`* -> *` kinded to match the kind of a component query algebra.
declarations.title: Prop

declarations.comments:
Data type for Halogen components.
- `s` - the component's state
- `f` - the component's query algebra
- `g` - a functor integrated into the component's query algebra that allows
        embedding of external DSLs or handling of effects.
- `o` - the type of values observable via `peek`, used to allow parent
        components to see queries their children have acted upon.
- `p` - the type of slot addresses within the component - these values
        allow queries to child components to be specifically addressed.
declarations.title: ComponentP

declarations.comments: A type alias for self-contained Halogen components.
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments: The type for `HTML` rendered by a self-contained component.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `render` function - takes the component's
current state and returns a `HTML` value.
declarations.title: Render

declarations.comments: The DSL used in the `eval` function for self-contained components.
declarations.title: ComponentDSL

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `eval` function - takes a functorial value `i`
and returns a `Free` of the Halogen component algebra.

Usually `i` will be the same type as `f`, but sometimes it is useful to be
able to break up an `Eval` function into different parts, in which case
`i`'s type may differ.
declarations.title: Eval

declarations.comments: Builds a self-contained component with no possible children.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments: The type for `HTML` rendered by a parent component.
declarations.title: ParentHTML

declarations.comments:
A variation on `Render` for parent components - the function follows the
same form but the type representation is different.
declarations.title: RenderParent

declarations.comments: The type used for slots in the HTML rendered by parent components.
declarations.title: SlotConstructor

declarations.comments: The DSL used in the `eval` and `peek` functions for parent components.
declarations.title: ParentDSL

declarations.comments:
A variation on `Eval` for parent components - the function follows the
same form but the type representation is different.
declarations.title: EvalParent

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a component `peek` function that observes inputs to child
components.
declarations.title: Peek

declarations.comments: Builds a component that may contain child components.
declarations.title: parentComponent

declarations.comments:
Builds a component that may contain child components and additionally
supports the `peek` operation to allow the parent to observe queries that
descendant components have processed.
declarations.title: parentComponent'

declarations.comments:
The type used by component containers for their state where `s` is the
state local to the container, `p` is the type of slot used by the
container, and the remaining parameters are the type variables for the
child components.
declarations.title: InstalledState

declarations.comments:
Lifts a state value into an `InstalledState` value. Useful when providing
an initial state value for a parent component.
declarations.title: installedState

declarations.comments:
An intermediate algebra that parent components "produce" from their `eval`
and `peek` functions. This takes the place of `g` when compared to a leaf
(non-parent) component.
declarations.title: QueryF

declarations.comments:
An intermediate algebra used to associate values from a child component's
algebra with the slot the component was installed into.
declarations.title: ChildF

declarations.comments:
Queries a child component, for use within a parent component's `eval` or
`peek` function.
declarations.title: query

declarations.comments:
A version of [`query`](#query) for use when a parent component has multiple
types of child component.
declarations.title: query'

declarations.comments:
Creates a query for a child component where `p` is the slot the component
was installed into and `f' i` in the input query.

If a component is not found for the slot the result of the query
will be `Nothing`.
declarations.title: mkQuery

declarations.comments:
A version of [`mkQuery`](#mkQuery) for use when a parent component has
multiple types of child component.
declarations.title: mkQuery'

declarations.comments:
Lifts a value in the `QueryF` algebra into the monad used by a component's
`eval` function.
declarations.title: liftQuery

declarations.comments: Transforms a `Component`'s types using a `ChildPath` definition.
declarations.title: transformChild

declarations.comments:
Changes the component's `g` type. A use case for this would be to interpret
some `Free` monad as `Aff` so the component can be used with `runUI`.
declarations.title: interpret

declarations.comments:
Runs a component's `render` function with the specified state, returning
the generated `HTML` and new state.
declarations.title: renderComponent

declarations.comments:
Runs a compnent's `query` function with the specified query input and
returns the pending computation as a `Free` monad.
declarations.title: queryComponent

declarations.comments:
Represents a path through `Either` and `Coproduct` types for the state,
query algebra, and slots of a component. Used when installing children of
different types within a single parent component.
declarations.title: ChildPath

declarations.comments: Composes two paths.
declarations.title: compose

declarations.comments: An infix alias for `compose`.

A `ChildPath` that represents taking the left-hand choice for each of a
component's `Either` and `Coproduct`s choices.
declarations.title: cpL

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` that represents taking the right-hand choice for each of a
component's `Either` and `Coproduct`s choices.
declarations.title: cpR

declarations.comments: An identity `ChildPath`.
declarations.title: cpI

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a state value of type `s'` from a
value of type `s`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: injState

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` to attempt to get a state value of type `s` from a value
of type `s'`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: prjState

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a query algebra value of type `f'`
from a value of type `f`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: injQuery

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` to attempt to get a query algebra value of type `f`
from a value of type `f'`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: prjQuery

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a slot value of type `p'` from a
value of type `p`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: injSlot

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a slot value of type `p'` from a
value of type `p`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: prjSlot

declarations.comments:
Type alias for driver functions generated by `runUI` - a driver takes an
input of the query algebra (`f`) and returns an `Aff` that returns when
query has been fulfilled.
declarations.title: Driver

declarations.comments:
This function is the main entry point for a Halogen based UI.

The returned value contains the HTML element for the component tree that
then needs attaching to the DOM, and a driver function that can be used to
send actions and requests into the component hierarchy.

The returned driver function allows the "outside world" to communicate
with the UI - a common use case it to use the driver to changes to the
application state in combination with a routing library.
declarations.title: runUI

declarations.comments:
A type alias for the basic row of effects that Halogen uses. This can be
combined with app-specific effects to help keep type signatures more
manageable:

```purescript
type AppEffects eff = HalogenEffects (ajax :: AJAX, console :: CONSOLE | eff)

ui :: forall eff. Component State Query (Aff (AppEffects eff))
ui = ...

main :: Eff (AppEffects ()) Unit
main = runAff throwException (const (pure unit)) $ do
  app <- runUI ui state
  ...
```
declarations.title: HalogenEffects

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for event names.

The phantom type `fields` describes the event type which we can expect to
exist on events corresponding to this name.
declarations.title: EventName

declarations.comments: An initial encoding of HTML nodes.
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed event handler, hidden inside an
existential package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: HandlerF

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a attribute or tag namespace.
declarations.title: Namespace

declarations.comments:
A property can be:
- A JavaScript property for an element (typed, and may not have a
  corresponding attribute).
- A raw attribute for an element (stringly typed, will be added directly to
  the rendered element)
- A key value used for hinting when diffing HTML.
- An event handler.
- A initializer that is triggered once the element for the property has
  been added to the DOM.
- A finalizer that is triggered when the element for the property is
  removed from the DOM.
declarations.title: Prop

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed property, hidden inside an existential
package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: PropF

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a HTML tag name
declarations.title: TagName

declarations.comments:
This type class captures those property types which can be used as
attribute values.

`toPropString` is an alternative to `show`, and is needed by `renderAttr`
in the string renderer.
declarations.title: IsProp

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for HTML elements.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments: Populates the slot placeholder values in a `HTML` value.
declarations.title: fillSlot

declarations.comments: Create an event handler
declarations.title: handler

declarations.comments: Create an event handler that may do nothing
declarations.title: handler'

declarations.comments: Create a namespace
declarations.title: namespace

declarations.comments: Create an attribute
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Create an attribute name
declarations.title: propName

declarations.comments: Unpack a class name
declarations.title: runClassName

declarations.comments: Unpack an event name
declarations.title: runEventName

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `Namespace` to get the value as a `String`.
declarations.title: runNamespace

declarations.comments: Unpack an attribute name
declarations.title: runPropName

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `TagName` to get the tag name as a `String`.
declarations.title: runTagName

declarations.comments: Create a tag name
declarations.title: tagName

modules.name: Halogen.HTML
modules.comments:
This module re-exports the core types for the `HTML` DSL, and values for
all supported HTML elements.

Consider using the `Halogen.HTML.Indexed` variety of this module for
better type safety.

declarations.comments: Constructs a text node `HTML` value.
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component. Takes a slot "address" value and a
thunked constructor.
declarations.title: slot

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component when a parent has multiple types of
child component. Takes the `ChildPath` for the child component's type, a
slot "address" value and a thunked constructor.
declarations.title: slot'

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Core
modules.comments: The core types and smart constructors for the HTML DSL.

declarations.comments: An initial encoding of HTML nodes.
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for HTML elements.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments: Populates the slot placeholder values in a `HTML` value.
declarations.title: fillSlot

declarations.comments:
A property can be:
- A JavaScript property for an element (typed, and may not have a
  corresponding attribute).
- A raw attribute for an element (stringly typed, will be added directly to
  the rendered element)
- A key value used for hinting when diffing HTML.
- An event handler.
- A initializer that is triggered once the element for the property has
  been added to the DOM.
- A finalizer that is triggered when the element for the property is
  removed from the DOM.
declarations.title: Prop

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed property, hidden inside an existential
package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: PropF

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed event handler, hidden inside an
existential package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: HandlerF

declarations.comments: Create an attribute
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Create an event handler
declarations.title: handler

declarations.comments: Create an event handler that may do nothing
declarations.title: handler'

declarations.comments:
This type class captures those property types which can be used as
attribute values.

`toPropString` is an alternative to `show`, and is needed by `renderAttr`
in the string renderer.
declarations.title: IsProp

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a attribute or tag namespace.
declarations.title: Namespace

declarations.comments: Create a namespace
declarations.title: namespace

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `Namespace` to get the value as a `String`.
declarations.title: runNamespace

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a HTML tag name
declarations.title: TagName

declarations.comments: Create a tag name
declarations.title: tagName

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `TagName` to get the tag name as a `String`.
declarations.title: runTagName

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: Create an attribute name
declarations.title: propName

declarations.comments: Unpack an attribute name
declarations.title: runPropName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for event names.

The phantom type `fields` describes the event type which we can expect to
exist on events corresponding to this name.
declarations.title: EventName

declarations.comments: Unpack an event name
declarations.title: runEventName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments: Unpack a class name
declarations.title: runClassName

declarations.comments: An HTML element that admits children.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: A `Node` that doesn't support mouse events.
declarations.title: NoninteractiveNode

declarations.comments: An HTML element that does not admit children.
declarations.title: Leaf

declarations.comments: An `Leaf` that doesn't support mouse events.
declarations.title: NoninteractiveLeaf

declarations.comments:
This monad supports the following operations on events:

- `preventDefault`
- `stopPropagation`
- `stopImmediatePropagation`

It can be used as follows:

```purescript
import Data.Functor (($>))

H.a [ E.onClick \_ -> E.preventDefault $> clickHandler ]
    [ H.text "Click here" ]
```
declarations.title: EventHandler

declarations.comments: Call the `preventDefault` method on the current event.
declarations.title: preventDefault

declarations.comments: Call the `stopImmediatePropagation` method on the current event.
declarations.title: stopImmediatePropagation

declarations.comments: Call the `stopPropagation` method on the current event.
declarations.title: stopPropagation

declarations.comments:
This record synonym captures the properties which appear on every DOM event.

The `fields` type parameter allows us to attach different types of additional
properties to represent more specific types of events.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on focus events.
declarations.title: FocusEvent

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on keyboard events.
declarations.title: KeyboardEvent

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on mouse events.
declarations.title: MouseEvent

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Events
modules.comments:
This module defines well-typed wrappers for common DOM events, so that
they may be safely embedded in HTML documents.

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Events.Forms
modules.comments: Convenience functions for working with form events.

declarations.comments:
Attaches an event handler which will produce an input when the value of an
input field changes.
declarations.title: onValueChange

declarations.comments: Attaches an event handler which will fire on input.
declarations.title: onValueInput

declarations.comments:
Attaches an event handler which will fire when a checkbox is checked or
unchecked.
declarations.title: onChecked

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Events.Handler
modules.comments:
The `EventHandler` monad, used to perform standard operations on HTML
events.

declarations.comments:
This monad supports the following operations on events:

- `preventDefault`
- `stopPropagation`
- `stopImmediatePropagation`

It can be used as follows:

```purescript
import Data.Functor (($>))

H.a [ E.onClick \_ -> E.preventDefault $> clickHandler ]
    [ H.text "Click here" ]
```
declarations.title: EventHandler

declarations.comments: Call the `preventDefault` method on the current event.
declarations.title: preventDefault

declarations.comments: Call the `stopPropagation` method on the current event.
declarations.title: stopPropagation

declarations.comments: Call the `stopImmediatePropagation` method on the current event.
declarations.title: stopImmediatePropagation

declarations.comments: This function can be used to update an event and return the wrapped value
declarations.title: runEventHandler

declarations.comments:
This record synonym captures the properties which appear on every DOM event.

The `fields` type parameter allows us to attach different types of additional
properties to represent more specific types of events.
declarations.title: Event

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on mouse events.
declarations.title: MouseEvent

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on keyboard events.
declarations.title: KeyboardEvent

declarations.comments: Identifies the additional fields which are available on focus events.
declarations.title: FocusEvent

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component. Takes a slot "address" value and a
thunked constructor.
declarations.title: slot

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component when a parent has multiple types of
child component. Takes the `ChildPath` for the child component's type, a
slot "address" value and a thunked constructor.
declarations.title: slot'

declarations.comments: Constructs a text node `HTML` value.
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for event names.

The phantom type `fields` describes the event type which we can expect to
exist on events corresponding to this name.
declarations.title: EventName

declarations.comments: An initial encoding of HTML nodes.
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed event handler, hidden inside an
existential package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: HandlerF

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a attribute or tag namespace.
declarations.title: Namespace

declarations.comments:
A property can be:
- A JavaScript property for an element (typed, and may not have a
  corresponding attribute).
- A raw attribute for an element (stringly typed, will be added directly to
  the rendered element)
- A key value used for hinting when diffing HTML.
- An event handler.
- A initializer that is triggered once the element for the property has
  been added to the DOM.
- A finalizer that is triggered when the element for the property is
  removed from the DOM.
declarations.title: Prop

declarations.comments:
The data which represents a typed property, hidden inside an existential
package in the `Prop` type.
declarations.title: PropF

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for a HTML tag name
declarations.title: TagName

declarations.comments:
This type class captures those property types which can be used as
attribute values.

`toPropString` is an alternative to `show`, and is needed by `renderAttr`
in the string renderer.
declarations.title: IsProp

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for HTML elements.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments: Populates the slot placeholder values in a `HTML` value.
declarations.title: fillSlot

declarations.comments: Create an event handler
declarations.title: handler

declarations.comments: Create an event handler that may do nothing
declarations.title: handler'

declarations.comments: Create a namespace
declarations.title: namespace

declarations.comments: Create an attribute
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Create an attribute name
declarations.title: propName

declarations.comments: Unpack a class name

declarations.comments: Unpack an event name
declarations.title: runEventName

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `Namespace` to get the value as a `String`.
declarations.title: runNamespace

declarations.comments: Unpack an attribute name
declarations.title: runPropName

declarations.comments: Unwrap a `TagName` to get the tag name as a `String`.
declarations.title: runTagName

declarations.comments: Create a tag name
declarations.title: tagName

declarations.comments: An HTML element that does not admit children.
declarations.title: Leaf

declarations.comments: An HTML element that admits children.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: An `Leaf` that doesn't support mouse events.

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Properties
modules.comments: This module provides `Prop` values for some common HTML attributes.

declarations.comments:
The `key` property associates a unique key with a node, which can be used
to implement a more efficient diff/patch.
declarations.title: key

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Properties.Indexed
modules.comments:
A closed signature of type-indexed (refined) HTML properties; these can be
used to ensure correctness by construction, and then erased into the standard
unrefined versions.

declarations.comments:
The phantom row `r` can be thought of as a context which is synthesized in the
course of constructing a refined HTML expression.
declarations.title: IProp

declarations.comments: The refined property can be erased into a normal one.
declarations.title: erase

declarations.comments: A dummy type to use in the phantom row.
declarations.title: I

declarations.comments:
The phantom row `r` can be thought of as a context which is synthesized in the
course of constructing a refined HTML expression.
declarations.title: IProp

declarations.comments: Render a HTML document as a `String`, usually for testing purposes.
declarations.title: renderHTML

declarations.comments:
Render a `HTML` document to a virtual DOM node

The first argument is an event handler.
declarations.title: renderHTML

modules.name: Halogen.Internal.VirtualDOM
modules.comments:
This module provides the FFI definitions required to render HTML documents
using the `virtual-dom` library.

declarations.comments: Virtual DOM nodes
declarations.title: VTree

declarations.comments: Patch sets, used to update the DOM
declarations.title: Patch

declarations.comments: Property collections
declarations.title: Props

declarations.comments: Create a property from a key/value pair.
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Create a property from an event handler.
declarations.title: handlerProp

declarations.comments: Create a property from an initializer.
declarations.title: initProp

declarations.comments: Create a property from an finalizer.
declarations.title: finalizerProp

declarations.comments: Create a DOM node from a virtual DOM tree
declarations.title: createElement

declarations.comments: Calculate the differences between two virtual DOM trees
declarations.title: diff

declarations.comments: Apply a set of patches to the DOM
declarations.title: patch

declarations.comments: Create a virtual DOM tree which represents a single text node
declarations.title: vtext

declarations.comments:
Create a virtual DOM tree which represents an element with properties
(namespace, tag name, key, properties, children).
declarations.title: vnode

declarations.comments: The state algebra.
declarations.title: StateF

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a coroutine producer used to represent a subscribable
source of events.
declarations.title: EventSource

declarations.comments: The subscribe algebra.
declarations.title: SubscribeF

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts one argument.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onCopied = eventSource (Editor.onCopy editor) \text -> do
      pure $ actionF (TextCopied text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onChange = eventSource_ (Session.onChange session) do
      text <- Editor.getValue editor
      pure $ actionF (ChangeText text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource_

declarations.comments:
Changes the underlying monad for an `EventSource`. Used internally by
Halogen.
declarations.title: hoistSubscribe

modules.name: Halogen.Query
modules.comments:
Functions and types used to describe the `HalogenF` algebra used in a
component's `eval` and `peek` functions.

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "action" - An action only causes effects and has no
result value.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as a value. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a
  = SomeAction a
  | SomeOtherAction String a
  | NotAnAction (Boolean -> a)
```

Both `SomeAction` and `SomeOtherAction` have `a` as a value so they are
considered actions, whereas `NotAnAction` has `a` as the result of a
function so is considered to be a "request" ([see below](#Request)).
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates an action.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = Tick a

sendTick :: forall eff. Driver Query eff -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Unit
sendTick driver = driver (action Tick)
```
declarations.title: action

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "request" - a request can cause effects as well as
fetching some information from a component.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as the return value of a function. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = SomeRequest (Boolean -> a)
```
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates a request.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = GetTickCount (Int -> a)

getTickCount :: forall eff. Driver Query eff -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Int
getTickCount driver = driver (request GetTickCount)
```
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments: A type alias for the Halogen component algebra.
declarations.title: HalogenF

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of accessing the current component's state within an `Eval`
or `Peek` function. This is much like `get` for the `State` monad, but
instead of operating in some `StateT`, uses the `HalogenF` algebra. For
example:

``` purescript
data Query a = GetState (State -> a)

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (GetState k) = do
  currentState <- get
  pure (k currentState)
```
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
A version of [`get`](#get) that maps over the retrieved state before
returning the result. Useful in cases where only a portion of the state is
desired. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = GetX (Number -> a)
type State = { x :: Number, y :: Number }

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (GetX k) = do
  x <- gets _.x
  pure (k x)
```
declarations.title: gets

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of modifying the current component's state within an `Eval`
or `Peek` function. This is much like `modify` for the `State` monad, but
instead of operating in some `StateT`, uses the `HalogenF` algebra. For
example:

``` purescript
data Query a = Increment a
type State = Int

eval :: forall g. Eval Query State Query g
eval (Increment next) = do
  modify (+ 1)
  pure next
```
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of having a component subscribe to an `EventSource` from
within an `Eval` or `Peek` function.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting a `g` value directly into
`Free HalogenF` without the need to use `liftF $ right $ right $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftH

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting an `Aff` action directly into a
`Free HalogenF` when there is a `MonadAff` instance for the current `g`,
without the need to use `liftH $ liftAff $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftAff'

declarations.comments:
A convenience function for lifting an `Eff` action directly into a
`Free HalogenF` when there is a `MonadEff` instance for the current `g`,
without the need to use `liftH $ liftEff $ ...`.
declarations.title: liftEff'

declarations.comments: Changes the `g` for a `HalogenF`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: hoistHalogenF

modules.name: Halogen.Query.StateF
modules.comments:
A part of the `HalogenF` algebra that replicates a `MonadState`-like
interface.

declarations.comments: The state algebra.
declarations.title: StateF

declarations.comments:
Map over the state value using a function to extract the new state value
from the old state, and a function for modifying the state.
declarations.title: mapState

declarations.comments:
A natural transformation for interpreting the state algebra as some
`MonadState`-supporting monad. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: stateN

modules.name: Halogen.Query.SubscribeF
modules.comments:
A part of the `HalogenF` algebra that allows subscription to event
listeners.

declarations.comments:
A type alias for a coroutine producer used to represent a subscribable
source of events.
declarations.title: EventSource

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts one argument.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onCopied = eventSource (Editor.onCopy editor) \text -> do
      pure $ actionF (TextCopied text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for an event listener that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the event listener.
- The second argument is a handler that produces a value in `f`.

For example:

``` purescript
let onChange = eventSource_ (Session.onChange session) do
      text <- Editor.getValue editor
      pure $ actionF (ChangeText text)
```
(Taken from the Ace component example)
declarations.title: eventSource_

declarations.comments: The subscribe algebra.
declarations.title: SubscribeF

declarations.comments:
Changes the generating functor for an `EventSource`. Used internally by
Halogen.
declarations.title: remapSubscribe

declarations.comments:
Changes the underlying monad for an `EventSource`. Used internally by
Halogen.
declarations.title: hoistSubscribe

declarations.comments:
A natural transformation for interpreting the subscribe algebra as its
underlying monad, via a coroutine consumer. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: subscribeN

declarations.comments:
A utility for appending an `HTMLElement` to the element selected using querySelector
element once the document has loaded.
declarations.title: appendTo

declarations.comments:
A utility for appending an `HTMLElement` to the current document's `body`
element once the document has loaded.
declarations.title: appendToBody
